qas.question: By what year had DVD taken over the LaserDisc market?
Which collector group highly values LaserDisc for their rareness?
Until the end of what year were movies released in VHS, LD, and DVD in Japan?
What country was the only to receive a LD release of Disney's Song of the South?

context: Although the LaserDisc format was supplanted by DVD by the <a0_0>late 1990s<a0_0/>, many LD titles are still highly coveted by <a1_0>movie enthusiasts<a1_0/> (for example, Disney's Song of the South which is unavailable in the US in any format, but was issued in Japan on LD). This is largely because there are many films that are still only available on LD and many other LD releases contain supplemental material not available on subsequent DVD versions of those films. Until the end of <a2_0>2001<a2_0/>, many titles were released on VHS, LD, and DVD in <a3_0>Japan<a3_0/>.
